alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Lower Columbia Basin of Washington (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 5:18PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Benton, central Walla Walla and central Franklin Counties through 600 PM PDT... At 518 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wallula, or 13 miles southeast of Pasco, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kennewick, Pasco, Prescott, Wallula, Snake River, Finley, Burbank, Eureka, Highland and Matthew. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Lower Columbia Basin of Washington
